definition: weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: Faint winds, and a song fading and leaves falling.
sentences.chinese: 无力的风，歌声渐弱，落叶潇潇。

sentences.english: The world economy is also expanding international business as the perception of the globe becomes smaller.
sentences.chinese: 当全球感渐弱时，世界经济还在扩张国际贸易。

sentences.english: When job ebbs with his groans fading into slumber.
sentences.chinese: 当工作退潮而去，他在酣甜中渐弱了他的呻吟。

sentences.english: Conversely, the diminuendos caused relaxation, which slowed heart rate and lowered blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 相反地，渐弱会让人放松，减缓心跳速度与降低血压。

definition: to slow down gradually/slower and slower/(music) decelerando/ritardando
to become more and more/to gradually become
to speed up gradually/faster and faster/(music) accelerando
to arise again/to make a comeback/resurgence
the sun sets over western hills (idiom); the day approaches its end/fig. time of decline/the end of an era/Sic transit gloria mundi
to thin out gradually/to become fainter and fainter
